review_blob: great seasonal ale, pours dark with a thin tan head that lingered...smell is coffee, toffee and a little spice?...taste is typical porter, a little heavy on the coffee taste but great on a cold day.  To make this beer really sing try it with a small piece of chocolate in your mouth as you sip it...made a ok porter into a "wow" one

an amazing beer, from the deep color to the complex flavors, only got better as it warmed up.   A slightly bitter chocolate taste that sweetened quickly with just a hint of vanilla.  Good earthy aroma...not an everyday brew but one i will let age for a while

has a great deep amber color, but thats where it ends, the smell and taste i could only describe as "band-aid", it smelled and tasted like a band-aid that you pull off your finger with your teeth.  A surprising dude from sam adams for me, it was not a bad bottle either....
